result.execSummary:
The defendant Rickey Donelle Boyd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Reckless Homicide/Deliver Drugs, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Applicable fees, restitution, assessments, Court costs and surcharges including DNA assessment.  And you may have to give a swab, which you might be able to have expunged under 165.77.  
The Court orders DOC to collect any monetary amounts ordered today at the rate of max 25% of any amounts provided in Secs. 973.05(4)(b) and 973.20 while the defendant is in their control.
  Any monetary amounts that remain unpaid when the defendant is released from confinement are to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervisoin.  Any monetary amounts that remain unpaid when the sentence is completed are ordered reduced to a judgment against the defendant for the u npaid balance and collectin can then proceed under Sec 71.935 as well as other collection procedures.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Per Remittitur dated November 7, 2018, Appeal No. 2016AP001796 CRNM (2014CF004197) and 2016AP001797 CRNM (2015CF000924), IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on September 20, 2018, that:  
IT IS ORDERED that the judgments of the cirucit court are summarily affirmed.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21. 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Pamela Moorshead is relieved of any further representation of Boyd in these matters.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(3).

records.addlTxt: from Jacqueline Schmidt.

Defendant Rickey Donelle Boyd in court with attorney Thomas John Erickson.  Defendant Rickey Donelle Boyd in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  The trial date is vacated.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas John Erickson in court, defendant Rickey Donelle Boyd not in court, in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 7.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Parties contacted the court to request a final pretrial date closer to the trial date as they are engaging in negotiations to resolve this case in lieu of trial.   Case adjourned for final pre-trial on 10.5.15 instead of 9.10.15

Attorney Thomas John Erickson in court, defendant Rickey Donelle Boyd not in court, in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for further proceedings. Parties advise the court a resolution has not yet been reached but are still in negotiations. Case remains scheduled for final pretrial on 9/10/15 and for jury trial on 10/26/15. Parties advised as of August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams,  Branch 07, Room 620 of the Safety Building. Case adjourned to Branch 25.

Defendant Rickey Donelle Boyd in court with attorney Thomas John Erickson.  Defendant Rickey Donelle Boyd in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case heard for Br. 25.  Hearing on motion to dismiss proceeds.  Defendant wishes to address the Court.  Court advises the defendant that whatever he says can be used against him.  Defendant states he understands.  State does not object if the Court is willing to listen to defendant.   Defendant reads a prepared argument to the Court.  State makes arguments.  Court finds there was no due process violation or statutory violation and does not deprive the Court of jurisdiction.  Court denies defense motion.   Case remains set for final pretrial and jury trial.
Branch 25 is in trial and unable to hear this matter. Branch 44 agreed to hear this matter for Branch 25. Parties notified. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Motion to Dismiss filed by attorney Erickson with attached cover letter received and filed in case 14CF924. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Response to Boyd's Motion to Dismiss received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Attorney Thomas John Erickson in court, defendant Rickey Donelle Boyd not in court, in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for status of counsel. Parties advise the Court this matter may resolve but request final pretrial and jury trial dates. Defense counsel may be filing motions in this matter. Parties to file motions by 6/12/15. Any motions requiring testimony will be heard on the final pretrial date. Parties to file witness lists, jury instructions, and motions in limine by the final pretrial date. State to file proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions by the final pretrial date. Parties advised as of 8/01/15 this case will be assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 07 in Room 620 of the Safety Building. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Further proceedings scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Erickson has recently been appointed on this matter and contacted the court to request a different status of counsel date. State notified and does not object. Court vacated further proceedings date of 5/29/15. Case adjourned to 5/26/15 at 8:30 a.m. for Further Proceedings in Branch 25. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Rickey Donelle Boyd in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Rickey Donelle Boyd in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for motion hearing. Defense counsel previously filed a motion to withdraw as counsel. Court GRANTED defense request for reasons stated on the record. Court reviewed motions in limine filed by the defnse. Court vacated the jury trial date of 7/27/15 and converted the final pretrial date of 5/29/15 to a status of counsel date. Court ordered attorney Voss to appear at the next court date to turnover discovery to new counsel. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Further proceedings scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard L. Voss in court, defendant Rickey Donelle Boyd not in court, in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for motion hearing. Defendant was not produced from the House of Correction. Court ordered this matter adjourned to allow the defendant to appear. Case remains scheduled for final pretrial on 5/29/15 and for jury trial on 7/27/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered this matter be set to address defense counsel's motion to withdraw. Parties notified. Case adjourned to 5/11/15 at 1:30 p.m. for Motion Hearing in Branch 25. Clerk notified Sheriff's Department to have the defendant produced. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.
